block.p: Kate Elizabeth Halpern and Scott David Fisher are to be married today by Cantor Kerry Ben-David at Lyndhurst, the Jay Gould house in Tarrytown, N.Y.

The bride, 26, is the publicist for ''The Rosie O'Donnell Show'' in New York. She graduated from Tufts University. She is the daughter of Sheila Halpern and Dr. Stephen Halpern of Pleasantville, N.Y. Her father is a professor of social science at the Borough of Manhattan Community College, and her mother is the business manager at Lyndhurst.
Kate Elizabeth Halpern and Scott David Fisher are to be married today by Cantor Kerry Ben-David at Lyndhurst, the Jay Gould house in Tarrytown, N.Y.

The bride, 26, is the publicist for ''The Rosie O'Donnell Show'' in New York. She graduated from Tufts University. She is the daughter of Sheila Halpern and Dr. Stephen Halpern of Pleasantville, N.Y. Her father is a professor of social science at the Borough of Manhattan Community College, and her mother is the business manager at Lyndhurst.

The bridegroom, 28, is an associate and a strategic consultant at Booz Allen & Hamilton, the consulting firm, in New York. He graduated cum laude from Vassar College and received an M.B.A. from Yale University. He is a son of Dr. Julie Fisher Peck of Lebanon, Ohio, and the late Henry Fisher. His mother is a program officer at the nonprofit Kettering Foundation in Dayton, Ohio, which conducts research on public opinion and government policy. His father was a lawyer in New Haven. The bridegroom's stepfather, Richard Peck, retired as a distribution manager at the Union Carbide Corporation in Danbury, Conn.
